We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD3$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD3$ will be in the hundreds place: 
 $\maroonD{3}$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD4$.  

  So  $\blueD4$ goes in the tens place:  

$\maroonD{3}\blueD4$ $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD6$.  The  $\greenD6$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{3}\blueD4\greenD6$

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{3}\blueD4\greenD6$.
